cyclone.name: LAURA
cyclone.current_location: about 15 miles south of Cayo Largo, Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: moving west-northwest today, then turning northwest across the central Gulf with the core aiming toward the Texas–Louisiana border
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: north-western Gulf Coast near the TX/LA border (around Cameron-Port Arthur area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: None issued yet (watches expected later today for northwest Gulf Coast)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: coastline from upper Texas (Galveston Bay) eastward through southwest Louisiana
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Likely (NHC outlook 4–8 inches with isolated 12 inches near TX/LA border)
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: Likely (storm-surge watch anticipated, life-threatening surge possible)
weather_observation.wind: High likelihood of sustained tropical-storm winds with a 30% chance of 50-kt winds and potential hurricane-force gusts at landfall
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential inundation exceeding 3 ft possible along Sabine Lake and adjacent coastline
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches with isolated totals to 12 inches, causing flash and urban flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf/rip currents and the possibility of isolated tornadoes as the storm moves inland
